review.title: A Scheme for Approximating Probabilistic Inference
review.abstract: This paper describes a class of probabilistic approximation algorithms based on the elimination of buckets and providing an adjustable level of accuracy and efficiency. We analyze the approximation for several tasks: to find the most likely explanation, to update beliefs and to find the maximum a posteriori hypothesis. We identify regions of completeness and provide preliminary empirical evaluations on randomly generated networks.
